item.title: youprat add a quote by Walter Moers
item.description: "Wednesdays were the best thing about Atlantis. The middle of the week was a traditional holiday there. Everyone stopped work and celebrated the fact that half the week was over." -- Walter Moers

item.title: youprat add a quote by Walter Moers
item.description: "Someone with an obsession for arranging things in alphabetical order was an abcedist, whereas someone with an obsession for arranging them in reverse alphabetical order was a zyxedist." -- Walter Moers

item.title: youprat add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: youprat add a quote by Noah Webster
item.description: "The heart should be cultivated with more assiduity than the head." -- Noah Webster

item.title: youprat add a quote by Edward Gibbon
item.description: "The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators." -- Edward Gibbon

item.title: youprat add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: youprat add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "To educate a person in the mind but not in morals is to educate a menace to society." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: youprat add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Fellow-feeling. . .is the most important factor in producing a healthy political and social life. Neither our national nor our local civic life can be what it should be unless it is marked by the fellow-feeling, the mutual kindness, the mutual respect, the sense of common duties and common interests, which arise when men take the trouble to understand one another, and to associate together for a common object. A very large share of the rancor of political and social strife arises either from sheer misunderstanding by one section, or by one class, of another, or else from the fact that the two sections, or two classes, are so cut off from each other that neither appreciates the otherâ€™s passions, prejudices, and, indeed, point of view, while they are both entirely ignorant of their community of feeling as regards the essentials of manhood and humanity." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: youprat add a quote by Kiran Desai
item.description: "The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind." -- Kiran Desai
